IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDE EXCEPTIONAL EDUCATION INSPIRING A PASSION FOR LEARNING, GROWTH & A COMMITMENT TO EXCELLENCE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: SITUATED ON A BEAUTIFUL 800-ACRE CAMPUS IN OWINGS MILLS MD, MCDONOGH SCHOOL IS A COEDUCATIONAL, COLLEGE PREPARATORY, INDEPENDENT PREKINDERGARTEN THROUGH 12 SCHOOL WITH AN OPTIONAL FIVE-DAY BOARDING PROGRAM FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES 9-12. MCDONOGH SCHOOL IS A COMMUNITY THAT FINDS JOY IN WORK, IN PLAY, IN DISCOVERY, AND IN THE REALIZATION OF PERSONAL POTENTIAL. STRONG, MUTUALLY RESPECTFUL RELATIONSHIPS INSPIRE A PASSION FOR TEACHING AND LEARNING, A DEDICATION TO PERSONAL INTEGRITY, AND A COMMITMENT TO EXCELLENCE. EMBRACING DIVERSITY OF BACKGROUND, CULTURE, AND THOUGHT, THE SCHOOL BUILDS UPON ITS FOUNDER'S ORIGINAL MISSION TO PROVIDE LIFE-ALTERING OPPORTUNITIES AND TO DEVELOP IN STUDENTS THE WILL "TO DO THE GREATEST POSSIBLE AMOUNT OF GOOD."
IRS990.Desc: MCDONOGH SCHOOL IS A HIGHLY REGARDED COEDUCATIONAL, INDEPENDENT SCHOOL WITH APPROXIMATELY 1,450 STUDENTS IN PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH TWELFTH GRADE. AN OPTIONAL FIVE-DAY BOARDING PROGRAM IS AVAILABLE FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES 9-12. MCDONOGH'S ACADEMIC PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO FOSTER A LOVE OF LEARNING. THE LOWER SCHOOL PROVIDES A SOLID FOUNDATION WITH AN EMPHASIS ON READING, WRITING, AND MATHEMATICS. TEACHERS WELCOME CHILDREN AS INDIVIDUALS, TAILORING THE ACADEMIC CURRICULUM TO DEVELOP THEIR FULL POTENTIAL-INTELLECTUALLY, PHYSICALLY, SOCIALLY, AND EMOTIONALLY. THE MIDDLE SCHOOL BUILDS ON THAT FOUNDATION WITH APPRECIATION FOR THE INTELLECTUAL, PHYSICAL, SOCIAL, AND EMOTIONAL NEEDS OF YOUNG ADOLESCENTS. STUDENTS LEARN THE ELEMENTS OF RESPONSIBLE SCHOLARSHIP IN READING, ENGLISH, WORLD LANGUAGES, MATHEMATICS, SCIENCE, SOCIAL STUDIES, AND TECHNOLOGY. THE UPPER SCHOOL COMBINES RIGOROUS ACADEMICS WITH A WIDE VARIETY OF EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. IN AN ENVIRONMENT THAT FOSTERS VERSATILITY, STUDENTS SELECT HONORS AND ADVANCED COURSES, DEVELOP THEIR ATHLETIC AND ARTISTIC ABILITIES, LEARN LEADERSHIP AND TEAMWORK SKILLS, AND GRADUATE WELL PREPARED FOR COLLEGE.FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 10A:THE POLICIES DESCRIBED IN PART VI, SECTION B, LINES 10A-16B APPLY TO MCDONOGH SCHOOL, INC. AND ITS AFFILIATE AS LISTED BELOW: FOLIO NETWORK, LLC

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ARTWORK AND ANTIQUES ARE AVAILABLE TO PROVIDE STUDENTS WITH ART EDUCATION ENRICHMENT.
THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENTS CONSIST OF VARIOUS FUNDS ESTABLISHED TO SUPPORT A VARIETY OF SCHOLARSHIPS, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND GENERAL OPERATIONS OF THE SCHOOL.

ASC 740, INCOME TAXES, PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD AND A MEASUREMENT ATTRIBUTE FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN, AS WELL AS GUIDANCE ON DE-RECOGNITION, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENT REPORTING DISCLOSURES. FOR THESE BENEFITS TO BE RECOGNIZED, A TAX POSITION MUST BE MORE-LIKELY-THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES. THE AMOUNT RECOGNIZED IS MEASURED AS THE LARGEST AMOUNT OF BENEFIT THAT IS GREATER THAN FIFTY PERCENT LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT. THE SCHOOL RECOGNIZES INTEREST AND PENALTIES ACCRUED ON ANY UNRECOGNIZED TAX EXPOSURES AS A COMPONENT OF INCOME TAX EXPENSE. THE SCHOOL DOES NOT HAVE ANY AMOUNTS ACCRUED RELATING TO INTEREST AND PENALTIES AS OF JUNE 30, 2022 AND 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. AFTER THAT REVIEW, THE FORM 990 IS POSTED ON THE TRUSTEE WEBSITE FOR APPROVAL BEFORE IT IS FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COPIES OF THE CONFLICT-OF-INTEREST POLICY AND RELATED QUESTIONNAIRE ARE SUBMITTED TO ALL INTERESTED PARTIES AND ALL CURRENT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO REVIEW, COMPLETE, AND SIGN. THE QUESTIONNAIRE WHICH DISCLOSES, IF APPLICABLE, ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS, IS SUBMITTED TO THE VICE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR REVIEW. ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE RESOLVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. IF A CONFLICT EXISTS, THE INTERESTED PERSON IS PROHIBITED FROM PARTICIPATING IN THE GOVERNING BODY'S DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS SURROUNDING THE CONFLICTED MATTER. THE CONFLICT-OF-INTEREST POLICY IS ANNUALLY REVIEWED BY THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MCDONOGH SCHOOL MAINTAINS AN EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION POLICY FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR BOTH OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES. MCDONOGH SCHOOL USES PEER DATA PROVIDED BY IRS FORM 990 AND DATA PROVIDED BY BOTH AIMS (ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT MARYLAND SCHOOLS) AND NAIS (NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS) FOR COMPARABILITY PURPOSES. THE INDEPENDENT BOARD HIRES AND DETERMINES COMPENSATION OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, WHO THEN HIRES AND DETERMINES COMPENSATION OF OTHER TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIALS, OFFICERS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES. ALL COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED BASED ON PERFORMANCE, COMPARABLE COMPENSATION DATA, AND BUDGETARY GUIDELINES AS APPROVED BY COMMITTEES OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
